sense.name: An agent deprives someone or something of oxygen and prevents breathing.
sense.examples: The child suffocated herself with plastic. He suffocated his wife with a pillow. She thought about how to suffocate her husband.

sense.name: An object impairs the respiration of someone or something.
sense.commentary: Note: death does not necessarily result.
sense.examples: The dog suffocated on a bone. The foul air suffocated the children. Carbon monoxide suffocated the driver. The child suffocated under the pillow. The air in this room is suffocating me.

sense.name: (Cause to) become suppressed or stifled in development.
sense.examples: His job suffocated his creativity. Marriage is suffocating him.
